item.title: Assignment 1
item.description: Assignment 1: Computer Science Due Date: Monday, September 18, 2017 at 10 pm This assignment goes over essential computer science topics and software engineering practices with applications to data science. Make sure to clone your [Classroom repository]() and install Pycharm before lab on Tuesday. Tuesday’s lab instructions Thursdays lab instructions Assignment 1 instructions As another reminder, you will be submitting your completed files for both the labs and assignment to your GitHub repository at a1-computer-science-<YOUR_GITHUB_USERNAME>.

item.title: Assignment 0
item.description: Assignment 0: Introduction to Git, Jupyter & Pandas Due Date: will be finished during lab on Thursday, September 7, 2017 Instructions Feedback Survey

item.title: Inclusion Statement
item.description: Professionalism, Diversity and Inclusion Statement Our intent is that this course provides a welcoming and inclusive environment that is free of any form of discrimination and harassment. All members of our community, including the students, TAs, faculty, and staff, are expected to treat one another in a professional and respectful manner. Our TAs have undergone training in diversity and inclusion. If you feel you have not been treated in a professional or respectful manner by any of the course staff, please contact either the course instructors, our DGS, or the Graduate School.

item.title: Resources
item.description: Learning Python Problem Solving with Algorithms and Data Structures using Python Online, interactive Python interpreter Beginner's Python cheatsheet (PDF) Official Python 3 tutorial MATLAB–Python–Julia cheatsheet Department & University Resources Diversity and Inclusion Support Student and Employee Accessibility Services (SEAS) Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS)
